nodes.bodyText: I don't think you need the entityClass if you also have the projection (The projection should have the class as well).
nodes.diffHunk:

-    public RootCollectionFetchQueryBuilder(Class<?> entityClass,

nodes.bodyText:
There is a bit of duplication between fields inside the relationship and fields inside the entityProjection.
Not a huge deal, but I think we ought to refactor the Relationship interface in AbstractHQLQueryBuilder by:

remove getChildren (its never used).
add a method to return the projection.
getChildType should have a default implementation that sources this data from the new method in 2.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -24,10 +25,11 @@

-    public SubCollectionFetchQueryBuilder(Relationship relationship,
+    public SubCollectionFetchQueryBuilder(EntityProjection entityProjection,

nodes.bodyText: We can remove entityClass (as it is already contained in the new entity projection parameter)

nodes.bodyText: We can remove the entityClass param.
Technically, the entity projection should have the filter clause too.

Setting and resetting the mock this way (including the old code) seems fairly hacky.
I suggest we initialize this class with a mock entity projection.  Let's add a @BeforeEach or AfterEach annotation which resets the mocks.
Each method will have to setup the projection the way that. makes the most sense.
Do we need a method for this?
I had to create this method, due to the fact that calling super should be the first statement of the constructor, where this method is used.
The entity projection includes the Filter as well (not just the sorting and the pagination)
This method should get the entityProjection from the relationship - so there is no parameter duplication

nodes.bodyText: Same comment here.  getTotalRecords should only really need the relationship.
